meanings.definition: The quality or state of being observable.
meanings.sent1: The observability of the stars in the night sky is truly breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the observability of different phenomena to understand the world better.
meanings.sent3: The detective's keen observability helped solve the mysterious case in no time.
meanings.sent4: Her observability in noticing small details made her an excellent art critic.
meanings.sent5: The observability of the colorful birds in the park brought joy to the visitors.

meanings.definition: The extent to which a system's internal state can be inferred from its outputs.
meanings.sent1: The observability of the machine's performance indicators helped the engineers identify the issue quickly.
meanings.sent2: Software developers aim to improve the observability of their applications for easier troubleshooting.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the audience's lack of observability to create the illusion.
meanings.sent4: The observability of emotions through body language is a fascinating aspect of human interaction.
meanings.sent5: The observability of a person's mood can sometimes be misleading, so it's essential to communicate openly.
